intro: Moehringia sedoides var. tendae, commonly known as the Sierra crescent-moss, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are tiny, white to pale pink, and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This species thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
